name: Premier Inn Manchester - West Didsbury

reviews.text: Spent 1 night in Premier Inn visiting friends in Northenden. Does exactly what it says on the tin. First time we sayed here we were on the ground floor and for some reason the room felt much nicer. This time we were on 3rd floor. Was fine. Room was very warm and couldn't seem to turn down the temp. Both times I've stayed here we got a room facing the car park and not the busy road so no issues with noise, except a church across the road had heavens bells ringing from cock crow.
reviews.title: another predictable satisfactory stay
Shame about the room configuration
reviews.text: Generally find Premier Inn very reliable for a good nights sleep and this one was no different.

My friend and I were visiting another mate and so booked online with this Premier Inn as it was close by. Unfortunately they failed to mention that we would be in a twin room which had a double and convertible sofa single. Needless to say the adult who slept on the single sofa convesion had a poor nights sleep as these are really not height appropriate for anyone over about 5 foot 5". To add insult to injury the heating was not working and so we were uncerimonially issued with a fan heater and told to turn that on when it was cold and turn it off when we were warm enough, I think that they failed to think abou the logistics of this as both of us wished to go to sleep rather than keeping a vigil over the heater all night...
reviews.title: A bit of a Shame on Advertised Value - That doesn't convey Premier

reviews.text: We have stayed here before and would recommend it. The reception staff are very welcoming, the rooms are ‘roomy’ and clean. The breakfast is next door in the adjacent pub, and was terrific value, we recently had the continental, but the ‘Full English’ previously was great.
reviews.title: Comfy beds!

reviews.text: My only reservation about Premier, is that they continue to offer the £29 option, but it does not ever seem to be available, on this occasion, we struggled to book two rooms at the same £48 option, but paid £58, so protecting the Premier Brand image of delivering what they advertise suggests they need to look at this as it doesn’t reflect the actual price paid, then leaves you feeling aggrieved.
reviews.title: Premier Inn - Most enjoyable stay

reviews.text: good friendly hotel, reasonably well located, not too far from city center. Continental breakfast could do with an update, not very interesting selection really but was adequate. Have had full English on a previous visit and that was fine.
reviews.title: Reasonable value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed early December on a Saturday and were lucky enough to get a room for £29. We got an excellent friendly welcome from the reception staff. Our room was spacious, clean and had good quality furnishings.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent night's sleep, there being no disturbances from fellow guests that one sometimes gets from budget hotels.
reviews.title: Hotel acceptable, pricing policy questionable

reviews.text: The car parking facilities are excellent and free and there is a pub next to the hotel which serves reasonably priced (especially with the special offers we received when we booked the hotel on-line), and well cooked basic pub food.
reviews.title: Unfriendly staff, breakfast was supermarket value food, long waits for staff to attend, cold atmosphere ..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Central Manchester is about 4 miles away, about 20 mins on the bus. The bus stop is a few minutes walk away on the other side of the road. A day rover ticket is excellent value at about £3.50.
reviews.title: A great Budget Hotel

reviews.text: The staff were super friendly and efficiant and generally if you are travelling with children they make things very easy. Free kids breakfasts, good value kids meals with lots of choice and activity sheets. The room was really clean, the only things I needed were another power point and a nightlight.
reviews.title: Easy if you are with kids

reviews.text: The staff were helpful and friendly. There were plenty of car parking spaces. The breakfast was massive. We were visiting family who lived nearby, but it is easy to jump on a bus into town. clean room.
reviews.title: Good value overnight stay

reviews.text: We really enjoy our weekly fish and chips Karen and Jeanette. Table 46
reviews.title: Nice and relaxed

reviews.text: I've stayed here a couple of times whilst working away from home. The hotel is OK, both times everything was clean and tidy and the reception staff were polite, friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Premier Inn - as expected

reviews.text: IMPORTANT: do not take a room on the "road side" of the hotel. You need to be on the "car park" side. If you can't, make sure you are on the third floor. The reason is the damn night buses - they sit at the stop for fifteen minutes with their engine running and it wakes you EVERY TIME!. Clearly not the fault of the hotel, but annoying just the same. Our guys had to change rooms because of it!
reviews.title: Depressing
A good Premier Inn near to Christie Hospital and good restaurants
reviews.text: Nice hotel with friendly staff about 10 mins drive to Christie Hospital and 20 minutes walk to some excellent restaurants (Picollinos and Gusto). On site restaurant (Table Table) very good too and good value for the money (meal 1/2 price of two above). Good internet connection in the rooms (£20/week) or free in the restaurant.
£70 for a Saturday night in November for a double room - very good value for a fairly basic, very decent, quiet, budget hotel.
reviews.title: comfortable, clean, friendly, relaxed, quiet, cheap

reviews.text: Another great value Premier Inn. £58 for two nights stay. Comfortable bed, fairly quiet room, good shower. Can't ask for more at this price
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Premier Inn in West Didsbury is both clean and very friendly. We were made to feel welcome by the staff. An excellent breakfast. Offers basic accommodation but excellent value for money.
reviews.title: A Good Place in West Didsbury

reviews.text: I stayed for one night and found the Hotel to be very nice, the room was spotless and very quiet I did not have breakfast as I was away very early in the morning, the only complaint I would have is that breakfast is only served between 7am - 7.30am which is not ideal if you do not need to be up early
reviews.title: I would definately return to this hotel

aka: Premier Inn Manchester (West Didsbury) Hotel Manchester
